intro: Scaevola billardierei, commonly known as the coastal scabious, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers and is often found in coastal and sandy soils. The plant has a compact growth habit with small, rounded leaves. It is well adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Scaevola billardierei is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
